description: This document consolidates the procedures and capabilities for handling insider threat incidents, incorporating lessons learned from past incident handling activities into response procedures, training, and testing. It covers the entire incident handling process including preparation, detection, analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery phases.
mergedFrom: Insider threat incident handling procedures and capabilities documentation

description: This document outlines the physical access control system, encompassing various aspects of physical security. It includes entry and exit points, the role of guards, and the use of physical access control devices. Additionally, it covers output devices such as printers, monitors, scanners, and copiers, detailing their physical access controls. The document also addresses the physical access control for system distribution and transmission lines, focusing on wiring closets and cable protection. Each section provides specific guidelines and requirements to ensure comprehensive security coverage.
mergedFrom: Physical access control system documentation including entry/exit points, guards, and physical access control devices
Output device physical access controls documentation (printers, monitors, scanners, copiers)
Physical access control documentation for system distribution and transmission lines including wiring closets and cable protection

description: This document outlines comprehensive procedures and records for the prevention of unauthorized removal of maintenance equipment containing organizational information, media sanitization procedures for equipment removed for off-site maintenance, and system component delivery and removal authorization. Additionally, it covers media sanitization logs documenting review, approval, tracking, verification, and disposal actions.

description: This document consolidates configuration and scanning reports for wireless intrusion detection systems (IDS), intrusion detection and prevention systems (IDS/IPS), and intrusion detection systems (IDS) specifically for encrypted traffic inspection (AC-4(4)). It includes details on system configurations, scanning reports, alert logs, and the inspection of encrypted traffic. The document ensures comprehensive coverage of IDS/IPS configurations, operational logs, and specific protocols for encrypted traffic inspection.

Intrusion detection and prevention system (IDS/IPS) configuration and alert logs

description: This consolidated document addresses supply chain risk management, encompassing acquisition strategies, contract tools, procurement methods, risk tolerance, mitigation strategies, roles and responsibilities, and lifecycle security engineering processes. It includes a comprehensive Supply Chain Risk Management (SCRM) Policy and Procedures documentation, ensuring clarity and specificity in managing supply chain risks.
mergedFrom: Acquisition strategies, contract tools, and procurement methods documentation addressing supply chain risk mitigation

description: This document outlines the configuration settings for session timeout, network disconnect, device lock, account lockout, and re-authentication policies. For privileged and user sessions, session timeout and network disconnect are configured to trigger after a certain period of inactivity. The device lock configuration is set to lock after 15 minutes of inactivity (AC-11, AC-12). Account lockout is configured with thresholds for failed logon attempts and a specified lockout duration (AC-7). Re-authentication policy includes session timeout limits, with a maximum of 12 hours or 15 minutes of inactivity for AAL3.
mergedFrom: Session timeout and network disconnect configuration for privileged and user sessions
Session timeout and device lock configuration set to 15 minutes of inactivity (AC-11, AC-12)
Account lockout configuration showing failed logon attempt thresholds and lockout duration (AC-7)
Re-authentication policy and configuration showing session timeout limits (12 hours maximum or 15 minutes inactivity for AAL3)

description: A separation of duties matrix detailing role assignments for both privileged and non-privileged functions, including privileged and non-privileged administrators, as well as privileged administrative functions. This matrix ensures that no single individual has control over all critical aspects of the system, thereby maintaining security and accountability.
mergedFrom: Separation of duties matrix showing role assignments for privileged and non-privileged functions
Separation of duties matrix showing role assignments for privileged and non-privileged administrators
Separation of duties matrix showing role assignments for privileged administrative functions

description: This document outlines the configuration and utilization of automated mechanisms for the review, analysis, and reporting of audit records. The goal is to ensure efficient and effective management of audit records through automation.

description: This consolidated document includes FIPS 199 security categorization documentation, analysis, and supporting rationale, with a focus on FIPS PUB 199 Level determination and the High baseline. It is intended for use by security professionals and authorizing officials.

Development process documentation showing security and privacy requirements integration, standards and tools used, tool configurations, and integrity controls for process changes (reviewed annually)
Evidence of independent assessor qualifications and accreditation status (3PAO accreditation documentation)
Anti-counterfeit policy and procedures including detection and prevention measures for counterfeit components
Current Incident Response Policy and Procedures documentation, including version history, approval signatures, and evidence of annual review
Privileged access authorization documentation for authenticated vulnerability scanning activities (RA-5(5))
Social media and external site usage policy and restrictions documentation
CISA Emergency and Binding Operational Directives compliance status documentation

Acquisition contracts for systems, components, or services, including security and privacy functional requirements, assurance requirements, acceptance criteria, and Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Section 889 compliance documentation
Security function isolation implementation showing separation of security and non-security functions
Test environment documentation and evidence of security testing performed prior to production implementation of configuration changes
Continuous Monitoring Strategy and Plan documenting the approach, frequency, and responsibilities for ongoing security monitoring activities
Risk Assessment Policy and Procedures documentation addressing purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, and compliance requirements (RA-1)
Incident response support resource documentation, including help desk procedures, ticketing system access, and forensics service availability
Integrated incident response team charter, including team composition, deployment capabilities, time-to-deploy metrics, and cross-organizational coordination procedures
System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) documentation that incorporates security and privacy considerations, including defined roles and responsibilities throughout the lifecycle
US-CERT and CISA security alerts, advisories, and directives received and disseminated in the past year
Authorization to Operate (ATO) letter or memorandum from the Authorizing Official, including any conditions or limitations
Evidence of monthly privileged account reviews and semi-annual non-privileged account reviews (AC-2(j))
Separation of duties matrix with role assignments for physical access administration and enforcement
Evidence of vulnerability scanner updates within 24 hours prior to scans, including update logs or configuration records (RA-5(2))
Malicious code scanning logs showing weekly scans and real-time scanning at endpoints and network entry/exit points
Personnel screening and background investigation records, including initial screening and rescreening documentation per FedRAMP requirements
Contingency plan distribution list showing key contingency personnel by name and role
Current Information System Contingency Plan (ISCP) using the FedRAMP template, including all appendices
Developer personnel screening documentation, including access authorizations, background checks, clearances, and list of individuals authorized to perform development activities
Evidence of annual contingency training completion for personnel with contingency roles and responsibilities
Public key infrastructure (PKI) certificate validation procedures, including certification path construction and revocation checking
Component disposal procedures and documentation including techniques and methods for secure disposal of data, documentation, tools, and system components
Maintenance schedules and records for system components, including dates, descriptions, and personnel involved
Information sharing agreements and data classification guidelines (AC-21)
Remote access policy and procedures including VPN configuration and usage restrictions (AC-17)
Configuration Management Plan (CMP) with documented roles, responsibilities, processes, configuration items, and approval records
Mobile device encryption implementation evidence (full-device or container-based) (AC-19(5))
System owner and ISSO contact information and role assignments
Documented supply chain controls and processes to identify and address weaknesses in supply chain elements
Digital Identity Level (DIL) determination documentation (SSP Appendix E)
Evidence of encryption implementation for data at rest across all system components storing Federal data
Annual independent assessor vulnerability scan reports for operating systems/infrastructure, web applications, and databases (RA-5)
List of all user accounts (privileged and non-privileged) with assigned roles, permissions, and account types
Alternate power supply documentation demonstrating automatic activation capability for extended power loss
Access control documentation for configuration change privileges, including role definitions, separation of duties matrix, and quarterly privilege reviews
Enterprise architecture documentation showing how the system integrates with organizational architecture
Evidence of annual SSP review and updates addressing system changes or assessment findings
Concept of Operations (CONOPS) document describing operational environment and mission/business processes
Evidence of incident response testing conducted within the past six months, including test plans, functional test results, and JAB/AO approval documentation
Inventory of critical system assets supporting essential mission and business functions
System-wide audit trail compilation documentation showing time-correlated records from all network, data storage, and computing devices
Automated notifications of integrity violations sent to ISSO and security personnel
Device identification and authentication mechanisms documentation for local, network, and remote connections
Mobile device management (MDM) policy and configuration requirements (AC-19)
Information location documentation identifying where Federal data is processed and stored, including system component mappings and user access records
Role-based audit configuration change procedures and documentation of authorized individuals with audit configuration responsibilities
Concurrent session limits configuration (3 for privileged, 2 for non-privileged) (AC-10)
Evidence of annual contingency policy and procedures review and approval
Multi-factor authentication configuration documentation demonstrating phishing-resistant MFA implementation for privileged and non-privileged accounts
Maintenance support contracts and spare parts inventory for critical system components
Inventory of internal system connections including all authorized components, interface characteristics, and security requirements
List of individuals with authorized physical access to the facility where the system resides
Security and privacy function verification test results performed at system startup/restart and monthly
System Security Plan (SSP) document including all required sections per FedRAMP High Baseline requirements
